recipes.title: Spicy Roasted Tomato Guacamole

extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup of red onion, diced
extendedIngredients.name: red onion

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400.Roast cherry tomatoes and whole jalapeo for 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and let sit until cool.

Remove seeds from jalapeo and dice up half of the jalapeo. Set aside.In a bowl, add roasted cherry tomatoes, diced jalapeos, diced red onions, and minced garlic clove.Mash up avocados and put in bowl with the rest of the vegetables.
Add lime juice, juice from half an orange, salt and pepper.
Mix together and serve!{optional: top with crumbled queso fresco}

recipes.title: Turkey and Black Bean Tamale Pie

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 15 1/2-ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed
extendedIngredients.name: canned black beans

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons chili powder, or more to taste
extendedIngredients.name: chili powder

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup shredded extra-sharp Cheddar cheese (4 ounces)
extendedIngredients.name: shredded cheddar cheese

extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups cooked turkey, cut into bite-sized pieces (about 12 ounces)
extendedIngredients.name: turkey

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups homemade turkey stock or canned reduced-sodium broth
extendedIngredients.name: turkey stock

steps.step: Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly oil a 9-by-13-inch baking dish.2. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, heat the oil.
Add the onion and jalapeño and cook, stirring often, until the onion is golden, about 4 minutes.

Add the garlic and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Sprinkle with the flour and chili powder and stir until the vegetables are coated.3. Gradually stir in the broth, then stir in the tomato sauce and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer, uncovered and stirring often to avoid scorching, until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes. Stir in the turkey, black beans, and corn.

Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish.4. In another medium saucepan, bring 1 1/2 cups cold water and the remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt to a boil over high heat. In a small bowl, whisk the cornmeal with 1 1/2 cups cold water.
Whisk into the boiling water and cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture is thick and boiling, about 1 minute.
Spread over the turkey mixture as smoothly as possible. Sprinkle with the cheese.5.
Bake the tamale pie until the turkey mixture is bubbling, about 30 minutes.
Let the pie stand for 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Spicy Breaded Chicken

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 broiler/fryer chicken (3 pounds), cut into pieces and skinned
extendedIngredients.name: chicken

steps.step: In a plastic bag, mix bread crumbs, milk powder, chili powder, garlic powder and dry mustard; set aside.
Place milk in a shallow pan. Dip chicken pieces into milk, then place in bag and shake to coat.
Place chicken, bone side down, in a 13-in. x 9-in. baking pan coated with vegetable cooking spray.
Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 50 to 55 minutes or until juices run clear.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a plastic bag, mix bread crumbs, milk powder, chili powder, garlic powder and dry mustard; set aside. Place milk in a shallow pan. Dip chicken pieces into milk, then place in bag and shake to coat. Place chicken, bone side down, in a 13-in. x 9-in. baking pan coated with vegetable cooking spray. Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 50 to 55 minutes or until juices run clear.                                        Yield: 6 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Spicy Breaded Chicken in  Taste of HomeJune/July 1993, p18                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             One serving equals 233 calories, 154 mg sodium, 93 mg cholesterol, 8 g carbohydrate, 31 g protein, 8 g fat. recipes.title: White Chicken Chili

extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 can (15oz each) great Northern or Cannellini beans (don't drain)
extendedIngredients.name: canned cannellini beans

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup shredded monterery jack cheese, plain greek yogurt, parsley, optional for garnish
extendedIngredients.name: jack cheese

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut bite sized pieces
extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breasts

steps.step: In a large dutch oven (soup pot), heat olive oil over medium high heat.
Add diced chicken breast and cook until browned on all sides (about 5 minutes).
Add onion, green chilies, chicken broth, cumin, chili powder, paprika, beans, corn, and garlic powder. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook for about an hour, stirring occasionally.
Add milk and lime juice. Turn heat to medium and cook until milk is incorporated and chili is hot (about 10 minutes).
Serve immediately.
Add shredded cheese, greek yogurt and parsley for a garnish if desired.

recipes.title: Refreshing Detox Water

steps.step: Put oranges, lemon and cucumber in the water pitcher. Using a long spoon, gently mash fruits/veggies; this will release more flavor.Take the mint, and gently mash it to release the natural oils; add to the pitcher.
Add water to the pitcher, and stir to begin the infusion process.Drink/serve immediately, or store in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter and Jelly Muffins

extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 cup jam or preserves - your choice of flavor
extendedIngredients.name: preserves

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375F.Line muffin tin with baking cups or spray with cooking spray. Set aside.
Combine flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar in the bowl of your mixer.Stir in peanut butter until crumbly.
Whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and coconut oil.

Pour egg mixture in and mix on low speed just until combined.Fill each cup halfway with batter.Make a small well in the center with the back of a spoon and spoon in one tablespoon of jam into the center.Divide remaining batter among muffins cups.
Bake for 18 to 20 minutes.
Let cool slightly before serving.

recipes.title: Heirloom Tomato Bruschetta Soup

extendedIngredients.originalString: Good bread, cut into cubes and toasted
extendedIngredients.name: bread

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups heirloom tomato bruschetta (recipe here) (I used extra garlic)
extendedIngredients.name: heirloom tomato

steps.step: In a saucepan, mix the bruschetta, tomato juice and broth and bring to boil.Reduce to simmer and simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season to taste with salt & pepper.Preheat oven to 400 F.

Pour the soup into oven safe bowls and top with toast cubes, then cover the croutons with shredded cheese.Carefullly set the bowls in the oven and bake for about 10 minutes or until the cheese is good and melty and maybe even a little brown and bubbly on top.
Transfer the bowls to serving plates, garnish with fresh basil leaves (if desired) and serve immediately.
